Whatever it may look like, we are excited to get back to learning!

Are your scholars ready to jump back into learning? Here are a few things we recommend to help them get back in a learning mindset:

1. Create a Daily Schedule.
Wake up just a little earlier, implement a 'reading hour', and take some time to review material from last year.

2. Practice Back-To-School Behaviors:
For younger children, it can be beneficial to practice school behaviors at home. Practice learning routines such as raising their hands, taking bathroom breaks, or sitting in a circle to read.

3. Get Yourself Prepared:
Getting your children back in a school mindset starts with you! Take time to review your campus' website or reach out to the main office to ensure you know the back-to-school plan for you and your family!
